subclassFeature.name: Diverse Education
entries: You gain proficiency with three skills of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Lore
entries: You learn two spells of your choice from any class. The spells don't have to be from the same class, but they must be a cantrip or of a level that you can cast—as shown in the Class Features (Bard) table.
The chosen spells count as bard spells for you and don't count against the number of bard spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Peerless Skill
entries: When you make an ability check, you can spend one point of composition to inspire yourself. Roll a {@i Bardic Inspiration} die and add the number rolled to your ability check result.
You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this feature, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

subclassFeature.name: Collegiate Pledges
entries: You—and other bards of your college—are guided by the following collegiate pledges:

items: {@b Horde secrets:} Collect and broker secrets.
{@b Pull the strings:} Use those secrets to control people.
{@b Control the Narrative:} Create history in ways that benefit the college and yourself the most advantageously.

subclassFeature.name: Collegiate Inspiration
entries: You gain the ability to make your weapon attacks magically toxic to a creature's mind.

entries.name: Psychic Blades
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one use a point of composition to deal an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage to that target. You can do so only once per round on your turn. Furthermore, you can use this ability as a reaction, spending one point of composition to add that same psychic damage to an allies weapon attack. That ally must be able to hear you and be within 60 ft.
The psychic damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to {@damage 3d6} at 5th level, {@damage 5d6} at 10th level.

items: {@b I'm Not Listening:} The creature receiving the damage is immune if it can't hear you or is immune to being charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Maintain the Secret
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the {@spell Message} cantrip if you don't already know it.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Intrigue
entries: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit, the forgery kit, and one gaming set of your choice. You also learn three languages of your choice. Additionally, you can unerringly mimic the speech patterns and accent of a creature that you hear speak for at least 1 minute, enabling you to pass yourself off as a native speaker of a particular land, provided that you know the language.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Whispers
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to adopt a humanoid's persona. When a humanoid dies within 30 feet of you, you may spend a composition point to magically capture its shadow using your reaction. You retain this shadow until you use it or you finish a long rest. You can use the shadow as an action. When you do so, it vanishes, magically transforming into a disguise that appears on you. You now look like the dead person, but healthy and alive. This disguise lasts for 1 hour or until you end it as a bonus action. While you're in the disguise, you gain access to all information that the humanoid would freely share with a casual acquaintance. Such information includes general details on its background and personal life, but doesn't include secrets. The information is enough that you can pass yourself off as the person by drawing on its memories. You may spend a composition point to gain access to a more detailed memory, at the DMs discretion. Another creature can see through this disguise by succeeding on a Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check. You gain a +5 bonus to your check. Once you capture a shadow with this feature, you can't capture another one with it until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowed Mind
entries: You gain telepathy out to 60 ft. The contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to communicate in this way with it, but it must be able to understand at least one language. A creature without telepathy can receive and respond to telepathic messages but can't initiate or terminate a telepathic conversation.

Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means, unless you allow it. You can present false thoughts by succeeding on a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the mind reader's Wisdom (Insight) check. Additionally, no matter what you say, magic that would determine if you are telling the truth indicates you are being truthful if you so choose, and you can't be compelled to tell the truth by magic.

subclassFeature.name: College of Tongues
entries: You are a bard of the {@i College of Tongues} and you know the true power of words. You study languages, collecting fragments of dead and dying tongues to study, preserve, and—on rare occasion—discover secret {@i Words of Power}.

subclassFeature.name: Collegiate Pledges
entries: You—and other bards of your college—are guided by the following collegiate pledges:

items: {@b Speak Carefully:} Words have power—take care in which ones you use. Speak in the correct manner and use the right words for the right occasion.
{@b Save Dead Languages:} Never let a language die. Collect fragments of forgotten tongues and share them with others to study and preserve.
{@b Correct the Incorrect:} Bad grammar is a travesty. Point out linguistic mistakes and offer corrections so that others can learn from them.

subclassFeature.name: Collegiate Inspiration
entries: You have mastered a {@i Word of Power} that shares your linguistic talents with others.

entries.name: Wond of Power: Tongues
entries: You can spend your bonus action and one point of composition to speak aloud {@i Word of Power: Tongues}.

Choose a number of creatures that you can see equal to your Charisma modifier (to a minimum of 1). Each creature must a) be within 30 ft of you, b) have 50 hit points or fewer, and c) know at least one language.
For up to 1 hour, each target can understand any spoken language that you are proficient with.

subclassFeature.name: Exotic Tongue
entries: You have mastered one exotic language from which your {@i Words of Power} are drawn. Choose one of the following:

items: Abyssal
Celestial
Draconic
Deep Speech
Infernal
Primordial
Sylvan
Undercommon

subclassFeature.name: Words of Power
entries: Through careful study, you have mastered {@i Words of Power} in your exotic tongue.

entries.name: Words of Power

items: {@b Casting Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet
{@b Components:} V
{@b Duration:} 1 minute

entries: Choose one {@i Word of Power} and a creature you can see which has 50 hit points or fewer—that creature is now bound by your selected Word. If the creature is immune to the condition inflicted by your Word (or it has too many hit points) the effect fails.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest. You can't speak the same Word more than once per long rest, and a creature can only be affected by one {@i Word of Power} at a time.

{@b Compel} The creature is {@condition Charmed} by you for up to 1 minute. In addition, you can suggest one simple activity that it should take—limited to four words. The creature will disregard suggestions that are unreasonable or cause self-harm.
At the end of its turns, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to overcome the effect. The effect automatically ends if the creature is attacked by you or your allies.

items: {@b Fear} The creature is {@condition Frightened} by you—or another source you specify—for up to 1 minute. At the end of its turns, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to overcome the effect.
{@b Hold} The creature is {@condition Restrained} by you for up to 1 minute. At the end of its turns, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to overcome the effect.

{@b Isolate} The creature is {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Blinded}, and can't speak for up to 1 minute. At the end of its turns, the creature can make a Constitution saving throw to overcome the effect.
{@b Sicken} The creature is {@condition Poisoned} by you for up to 1 minute. At the end of its turns, the creature can make a Constitution saving throw to overcome the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Words of Power
entries: You can target creatures that have 75 hit points or fewer with your {@i Words of Power}.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Words of Power
entries: You can target creatures that have 100 hit points or fewer with your {@i Words of Power}.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Domain
entries: The gods of the forge are patrons of artisans who work with metal, from a humble blacksmith who keeps a village in horseshoes and plow blades to the mighty elf artisan whose diamond-tipped arrows of mithral have felled demon lords. The gods of the forge teach that, with patience and hard work, even the most intractable metal can be transformed from a lump of ore to a beautifully wrought object. Clerics of these deities search for objects lost to the forces of darkness, liberate mines overrun by orcs, and uncover rare and wondrous materials necessary to create potent magic items. Followers of these gods take great pride in their work, and they are willing to craft and use heavy armor and powerful weapons to protect them. Deities of this domain include Gond, Reorx, Onatar, Moradin, Hephaestus, and Goibhniu.

subclassFeature.name: Commandments
entries: You are guided by the following domain commandments:

items: {@b Create Masterworks:} Create to last. Take no shortcuts in what you create.
{@b Practice What You Preach:} Be realistic and set proper expectations. Expectations you set for others you should set on yourself.
{@b Magnum Opus:} Everything you do is leading up to the pinnacle of your artisanship. You will not know when, and you may not even know what. But it will happen, someday.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain the following domain spells.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Forge
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to imbue magic into a weapon or armor. At the end of a long rest, you can touch one nonmagical object that is a suit of armor or a simple or martial weapon. Until the end of your next long rest or until you die, the object becomes a magic item, granting a +1 bonus to AC if it's armor or a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls if it's a weapon.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
You gain two Channel Divinity powers: {@i Artisan's Blessing} and {@i Fortifying Rite}.

entries.name: Artisan's Blessing
entries: As an action, you touch a creature, giving them the blessing of an artisan's proficiency. For 10 minutes, they gain all of your weapon, armor, skill, and tool proficiencies, or until you dismiss this effect as a bonus action. While the effect is active, you lose all weapon, armor, skill, and tool proficiencies. If the creature is already proficient in one of the listed proficiencies, they instead add double their proficiency bonus to any checks (not attacks) they make using the listed proficiencies.

entries.name: Fortifying Rite
entries: As an action, you declare a holy rite of fortification in the area you are standing. All objects within 50 feet of you gain resistance to all damage for 1 minute.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you may choose one of the following benedictions.

entries.name: Artisan's Blessing
entries: Language proficiencies are also one of the proficiencies given, but not one of the proficiencies lost.

entries.name: Greater Artisan's Blessing:
entries: Starting at 10th-level, a creature that adds double proficiency bonus to any checks with a weapon proficiency also adds double proficiency bonus to attacks.

entries.name: Fortifying Rite
entries: You may choose one creature within 50 feet to also count as an object for the purposes of being an applicable target for the damage resistance.

entries.name: Greater Fortifying Rite:
entries: Starting at 10th-level, the creature may move outside of the 50 foot area and still keep the damage resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of the Forge
entries: At 8th level, the mastery of the forge grants you special abilities:

items: You gain resistance to fire damage.
While wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
You may deal fire damage on melee attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Life Domain
entries: The {@i Life Domain} focuses on the vibrant, positive energy that sustains all life. You channel this energy, pitting you against the forces of unnatural death and decay.

subclassFeature.name: Commandments
entries: You are guided by the following domain commandments:

items: {@b Protect the Living:} Help life to flourish in the world. When faced with a difficult choice, choose the side that promotes the most well-being—the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the one.
{@b Ease Suffering:} Look after the sick and wounded, and be kind to the dying—even those you might consider an enemy.
{@b Suffer Not the Undead:} Death is a natural part of life. Drive away those who seek to pervert the natural cycle, and return the undead to the grave.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain the following domain spells.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Whenever you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

entries.name: Greater Disciple of Life:
entries: Starting from 6th-level, when you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

entries.name: Disciple Training
entries: You gain proficiency with either (a) herbalism kits or (b) heavy armor—you may choose which.
You gain two Channel Divinity powers: {@i Preserve Life} and {@i Turn Undead}.

entries.name: Preserve Life
entries: As an action, you spend one point of faith to present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your cleric level. Choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you and divide those hit points among them.
This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.

entries.name: Turn Undead
entries: As an action, you spend one point of faith to present your holy symbol and censure the undead. Each undead creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier).

entries.name: If the Creature Succeeds:
entries: The creature is immune to your Turn Undead until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: If the Creature Fails:
entries: The creature is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you may choose one of the following benedictions.

entries.name: Destroy Undead
entries: When an undead creature fails its saving throw against your {@i Turn Undead}, the creature is instantly destroyed if its challenge rating is at or below CR 1/2.

entries.name: Greater Destroy Undead:
entries: Starting at 10th-level, undead creatures are instantly destroyed if their challenge rating is at or below CR 1.

entries.name: Fountain of Life
entries: The maximum hit points restored by your {@i Preserve Life} increases from five to six times your cleric level.

entries.name: Greater Fountain of Life:
entries: Starting at 10th-level, the maximum hit points restored by your {@i Preserve Life} increases from six to seven times your cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: When a creature takes damage from one of your spells or weapon attacks, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Empowered Strike:
entries: When you use a divine strike, you can spend one point of faith to increase the extra damage from {@damage 1d8} to {@damage 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Beast
entries: You are a fierce guardian of the wilds, changeable as the moon. You prowl as a great cat one night, soar over the treetops as an eagle the next day, and crash through the undergrowth as a bear to drive off a trespassing monster. The wild is in your blood.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Shifter
entries: You are able to use {@variantrule Wild Shape|GCC} on your turn as a bonus action, rather than as an action. In addition, you gain three additional primal traits of your choice.
At 3rd, 6th, and 10-level, you gain two additional primal traits of your choice.
Add the following primal traits to your list of trait options.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: As you are shapeshifting, you can spend one 1st or 2nd-level spell slot to increase your AC by +1. This bonus increases to +2 if you spend a 3rd or 4th-level spell slot, and +3 if you spend a 5th-level spell slot.
This effect ends when you end your wild shape.

entries.name: Primal Fury
entries: While you are shapeshifted, you can spend spell slots to deal harm to creatures that you attack.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend a spell slot to deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage per level of the spell slot expended.

entries.name: Regenerate Wounds
entries: While you are shapeshifted, you can spend a bonus action to spend one spell slot and regain {@dice 1d8} hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

entries.name: Sharp Claws
entries: As you are shapeshifting, you can spend one 1st or 2nd-level spell slot to increase your unarmed damage by +1. This bonus increases to +2 if you spend a 3rd or 4th-level spell slot, and +3 if you spend a 5th-level spell slot.
This effect ends when you end your wild shape.

entries.name: Size Shifter
entries: As you are shapeshifting, you may spend 1 primal power to alter the natural size category of your primal skin by one step larger or smaller.
This effect ends when you end your wild shape.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Walker
entries: You can learn the primal skin of Large beasts. Starting at 5th-level, this increases to Huge beasts.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Attack
entries: While you are shapeshifted, you can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
In addition, your unarmed attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Essence Master
entries: When you take on a wild shape, you can spend 1 additional primal power and choose two essences instead of one. You gain the benefits of both essences. To calculate the base AC and speed of your shapeshifted form, take the average of both essences.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Land
entries: You draw magical strength from the land itself. With its power, you safeguard the ancient knowledge and mysterious rites of your druidic kin.

subclassFeature.name: Power of the Land
entries: You learn one additional druid cantrip of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Land Spells
entries: Choose one type of land—arctic, coastal, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, or swamp. At 1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th-level, you gain access to two unique spells connected to that land.

Once you gain a land spell, you always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

entries.caption: Arctic
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good}
{@spell Commune with Nature}, {@spell Cone of Cold}

entries.caption: Coastal
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud}, {@spell Purify Food and Drink}

entries.caption: Desert
rows: {@spell Burning Hands}, {@spell Create or Destroy Water}
{@spell Create Food and Water}, {@spell Protection from Energy}

subclassFeature.name: Land's Stride
entries: You can move through nonmagical difficult terrain without spending extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement—such those created by the {@spell Entangle} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Ward
entries: You can't be charmed or frightened by elementals or fey. In addition, you are immune to poison and disease.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Sanctuary
entries: When a beast or plant creature attacks you, you can spend 1 primal power to have that creature make a Wisdom saving throw against your druid spell save DC.
On a failed save, the creature must choose a different target, or the attack automatically misses. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Spores
entries: Druids who are members of the Circle of Spores embrace the cycle of creating life from death and vice versa. These druids use the remnants of decay to synthesize something new, allowing the druids to break down and repurpose deceased flora and fauna.

subclassFeature.name: Spore Cloud
entries: When a large or smaller creature dies, you can use a reaction to cause a puff of spores to disperse from the corpse. The spores deal {@damage 2d4} poison damage to any creature that fails a constitution saving throw vs your Spell Save DC within a radius stemming from the target creature determined by its size category. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your wisdom modifier per long rest.

entries.name: Spore Vulnerability:
entries: Undead take no damage from this ability but automatically fail this saving throw.

items: {@b Small/Tiny}: 5 Foot Radius
{@b Medium/Large}: 10 Foot Radius
{@b Huge} (Prerequisite: 5th Level): 15 Foot Radius
{@b Gargantuan} (Prerequisite: 9th Level): 20 Foot Radius

subclassFeature.name: Fungal Facade
entries: You can learn the primal skins of Plants, and the time it takes to learn the primal skins of mushrooms and other fungi is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Contaminate Cultivation
entries: Creatures and corpses touched by your {@i Spore Cloud} ability become {@i Spore Touched} for one minute. You can spend one primal power to grow one of the following fungi on top of a {@i Spore Touched} corpse or creature. These fungi each have max hit points equal to 3 times your Druid Level, an AC of 9 + your Proficiency Bonus, and a speed of 0. They automatically fail any checks beyond their original purpose. A creature can use an action to remove one of these fungi from itself or another creature, killing it at the end of your next turn, unless otherwise specified. These fungi also wither and die after one minute.

entries.name: Spore Touched Immunity
entries: Constructs and creatures that do not need to breathe are immune to the {@i Spore Touched} condition. Creatures and corpses that have had a fungus grown from them in the last hour are also immune to the {@i Spore-Touched} condition.

entries.name: Mycelium Knots
entries: The target creature is restrained and its speed is 0. Removing this fungus with an action requires a Strength check vs your Spell Save DC. Creatures have advantage on checks made to grapple the target.

entries.name: Acid Sprinkler
entries: As a bonus action, you can make this fungus spray a glob of acid at a creature within 25 feet of it, using your Spell Attack Modifier to hit and dealing {@damage 2d4} acid damage. You can do this even while wild-shaped.

entries.name: Toxic Squish
entries: A creature that touches this fungus must make a Constitution saving throw against your Spell Save DC or be {@condition charmed} for 10 minutes unless it is immune to poison damage or the {@condition poisoned} condition. This does not affect the creature that this fungus grows from until it tries to remove the fungus with an action or the fungus dies. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each subsequent turn to end the effect early.

entries.name: Slime Mold
entries: This fungus fills a 20-foot cube touching the creature or corpse it is grown from. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

entries.name: High Morel
entries: This fungus extends 30 feet in any direction and can be easily climbed by a Medium or smaller creature without requiring a check as if they had a climb speed equal to their movement speed.

subclassFeature.name: Enriched Growth
entries: You can feed your fungi more nutrients to increase their health and gain additional effects. By growing fungi from two {@i Spore Touched} targets that are within 10 feet of each other, the fungus gains additional hp equal to 3 times your Druid Level. By growing them from three {@i Spore Touched} targets within 5 feet of each other, fungi gain one of the following effects based on their type.

entries.name: Mycelium Knots:
entries: Terrain within 10 feet of this fungus becomes difficult terrain.

entries.name: Acid Sprinkler:
entries: Needles from this fungus deal an additional {@damage 2d4} acid damage.

entries.name: Toxic Squish:
entries: A creature poisoned by this fungus hallucinates moving visions complete with sounds and smells within 20 feet of it. You control what the creature hallucinates, and the creature can discern the hallucination only by trying to make contact with it.

entries.name: Slime Mold:
entries: A creature leaving the area must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: High Morel:
entries: This fungus grows up to 60 feet and can support huge or smaller creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Sporacle
entries: Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher or spend primal power, you can create an aura of spores to circulate around you for one minute. While the aura is active, each creature that enters or starts its turn within a 10-foot radius of you becomes {@i Spore Touched} for one minute. This aura persists even when you wild shape.

While the aura is active, as an action, you can stimulate nearby spores to force every {@i Spore Touched} creature within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage.
When you do this, up to 5 {@i Spore-Touched} corpses or creatures that are reduced to 0 hit points by this ability each grow one fungus as if you had used {@i Contaminate Cultivation} on them.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Wildfire
entries: Druids who are members of the Circle of Wildfire understand the necessity of destruction, such as how a forest fire promotes growth. These druids bond with a primal spirit that harbors destructive tendencies, allowing the druids to use their power to create controlled flames that help flora and fauna reproduce and grow.

subclassFeature.name: Summon Wildfire Spirit
entries: You can summon the primal spirit bound to your soul. As an action, you can expend one primal point to summon your wildfire spirit, rather than assuming a beast form. The spirit appears in an unoccupied space of your choice you can see within 30 feet of you. The wildfire spirit is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the {@creature wildfire spirit|AACC} stat block.

You determine the spirit's appearance. Some spirits take the form of a humanoid figure made of gnarled branches covered in flame, while others look like beasts wreathed in fire. You always summon the same elemental—same name, memories, personality, etc—but you may choose its form each time it is summoned. It's form does not impact any of its abilities or attacks.

In combat, the wildfire spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take one of the actions in its stat block or to take the Dash, Disengage, Help, or Hide action. The wildfire spirit manifests for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or until you wild shape.

entries.name: Power It Up
entries: Primal Points and spell slots may be used to buff the Wildfire Spirit.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: When you summon your Wildfire Spirit, you can spend one additional primal point to increase its AC by +1. This bonus increases to +2 at 3rd level, +3 at 5th level, +4 at 7th level, and +5 at 9th level.

entries.name: Fan the Flames
entries: While summoned, you can spend spell slots to empower your Wildfire Spirit's attacks. Once per turn, when your Wildfire Spirit hits a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend a spell slot to deal an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage per level of the spell slot expended.

entries.name: Fuel for the Fire
entries: While summoned, you can spend a bonus action to spend one spell slot, if you do so, your Wildfire Spirit regains {@dice 1d8} hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

entries.name: Fiery Talons
entries: When you summon your Wildfire Spirit, you can spend one additional primal point to increase the damage of its flame talons by +1. This bonus increases to +2 at 3rd level, +3 at 5th level, +4 at 7th level, and +5 at 9th level.

entries.name: Size Matters
entries: When summoned, you may spend 1 primal power to alter the natural size category of your Wildfire Spirit by one step larger or smaller. Each point increases the size one category. To a maximum of medium at level 1, large at level 3, huge at level 7, and gargantuan at level 9. Each increase in size adds +2 to strength (this also provides a +1 to hit and damage rolls as a result), and 4 extra hit points.

entries.name: Hot Air
entries: Beginning at level 5, when summoned, you may spend 1 primal power to grant your Wildfire Spirit a flight speed (hover) equal to its base speed.

entries.name: Burning Bonds
entries: Beginning at level 7, whenever damage would reduce your Wildfire Spirit to 0 hit points, you can spend your reaction, one hit die and one primal power point to reduce your familiar to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Of Like Minds
entries: Beginning at level 9, when summoned, you may spend 1 primal power point to link your mind with your Wildfire Spirit. You can communicate telepathically with your Wildfire Spirit and perceive through your Wildfire Spirit's senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: You learn the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. It does not count against the maximum number of cantrips you can know. You gain the following spell options.

entries.caption: Arctic
rows: {@spell Locate Animals or Plants}, {@spell Scorching Ray}

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Bond
entries: The bond with your wildfire spirit enhances your destructive and restorative spells. Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire damage or restores hit points while your wildfire spirit is summoned, roll a d4, and you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell equal to the number rolled. In addition, when you cast a spell with a range other than self, the spell can originate from you or your wildfire spirit.

subclassFeature.name: Flames of Life
entries: You gain the ability to turn death into flames of vitality. When a Small or larger creature that you can see dies within 30 feet of you or your wildfire spirit, you can use your reaction to cause primal flames to spring from the body. When a creature you can see touches these flames, the creature regains hit points or takes fire damage (your choice) equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier. The flames vanish after a creature has touched them or after 1 minute. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blazing Endurance
entries: The bond with your wildfire spirit is exceptionally strong, even fatal blows only fuel your defiance. If you drop to 0 hit points while your wildfire spirit is summoned and don't die outright, you drop to 1 hit point instead and gain temporary hit points equal to five times your druid level, and each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that you can see takes fire damage equal to {@damage 2d10} + your druid level. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Champion
entries: A {@i Champion} hones their raw physical power to deadly perfection. You are one with your weapon, and you know how to exploit an opening to deal massive damage to your unworthy enemy.
Add the following four maneuvers to your list of maneuver options: counterattack, parry, pierce, and predict.

entries.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If the attack hits, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage with your weapon.

entries.name: Greater Counterattack
entries: (5th-level) You deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage with your weapon when you successfully counterattack.

entries.name: Superior Counterattack
entries: (9th-level) You deal an extra {@damage 1d10} damage with your weapon when you successfully counterattack.

entries.name: Parry
entries: When a target hits you with an attack roll and you are not incapacitated, you can spend your reaction and attempt to parry the attack. Roll {@dice 1d6} and add the result to your AC—if the attack roll doesn't beat your parry AC, it misses.

entries.name: Greater Parry
entries: (5th-level) You may roll {@dice 1d8} when you attempt to parry.

entries.name: Superior Parry
entries: (9th-level) You may roll {@dice 1d10} when you attempt to parry.

entries.name: Pierce
entries: When you miss with an attack roll against a creature, you can attempt to pierce through with sheer resolve. Roll {@dice 1d6} and add it your attack roll.

entries.name: Greater Pierce
entries: (5th-level) You can roll {@dice 1d8} and add it to your attack roll.

entries.name: Superior Pierce
entries: (9th-level) You can roll {@dice 1d10} and add it to your attack roll.

entries.name: Predict
entries: When you make an ability check and use Insight or Perception, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this maneuver, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Predict
entries: (5th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Predict
entries: (9th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d8} to {@dice 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: You can add half your proficiency bonus (round up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn't already use your proficiency bonus.
In addition, when you make a running long jump, the distance you can cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: You can choose a second option from the {@i Fighting Style} class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Commander
entries: A {@i Commander} gives orders and expects them to be followed. You direct your allies with tactical prowess and turn a band of ill-fitting misfits into a well-oiled machine.
Add the following four maneuvers to your list of maneuver options: direct, inspire, instruct, and order.

entries.name: Direct
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can direct an ally to move. Choose one friendly creature that is (a) within 30 ft of you or the creature you hit, (b) can see and hear you, and (c) has a movement speed greater than 0—that creature may spend its reaction to move up to 10 ft. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from the creature you hit.

entries.name: Greater Direct:
entries: (5th-level) Your ally may move up to 15 ft.

entries.name: Superior Direct
entries: (9th-level) Your ally may move up to 20 ft.

entries.name: Inspire
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can inspire a nearby ally. Choose one friendly creature that can see and hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier—you may choose which.

entries.name: Greater Inspire
entries: (5th-level) The creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Superior Inspire
entries: (9th-level) The creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Instruct
entries: When an ally misses with a weapon attack, you can instruct them to try again. If your ally can see and hear you, that ally can reroll their attack—if the attack hits, it deals {@damage 1d6} extra damage.

entries.name: Greater Instruct
entries: (5th-level) The attack deals {@damage 1d8} extra damage.

entries.name: Superior Instruct
entries: (9th-level) The attack deals {@damage 1d10} extra damage.

entries.name: Order
entries: When you make an ability check and use {@skill Persuasion} or {@skill Intimidation}, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this maneuver, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Order
entries: (5th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Order
entries: (9th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d8} to {@dice 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Commanding Strike
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your allies to strike.
Choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Commanding Action
entries: During another creature's turn, you can spend your reaction and one use of your {@i Action Surge} feature to grant that creature one additional action on top of their regular action and a possible bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Word of Command
entries: You can use your action to speak a one-word command to a creature. Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature can see and hear you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier) to resist being commanded. If the creature fails, it must follow the command on its next turn.
You can use this feature up to three times. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Command of Resolve
entries: When you speak a command, you can spend a number of resolve points to heighten your command. For each point of resolve you spend, you can target one additional creature with your command. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

entries.name: Immunities
entries: Your command has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

entries.name: Example Commands
entries: Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the GM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the effect ends.

items: {@b Approach:} The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.
{@b Drop:} The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.
{@b Flee:} The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.
{@b Grovel:} The target falls {@condition prone} and then ends its turn.

{@b Halt:} The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

subclassFeature.name: Defender
entries: A {@i Defender} protects their allies from harm. With keen senses and keener skill, you know how to spot incoming danger and shield your allies from it.
Add the following four maneuvers to your list of maneuver options: alert, bastion, sentry, and switch.

entries.name: Alert
entries: When you make an ability check and use {@skill Perception} or Initiative, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this maneuver, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Alert
entries: (5th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Alert
entries: (9th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d8} to {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Bastion
entries: When an ally within 5 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points from a weapon attack but not killed outright, you can intercept part of the attack—your ally drops to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this maneuver again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Greater Bastion
entries: (5th-level) You can use this maneuver two times per long rest.

entries.name: Superior Bastion
entries: (9th-level) You can use this maneuver three times per long rest.

entries.name: Sentry
entries: When an enemy that you can see moves within 5 feet of you, you can make one weapon attack against that creature as a free action. If your attack hits the creature, you deal {@damage 1d6} extra damage.

entries.name: Greater Sentry
entries: (5th-level) Your attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage.

entries.name: Superior Sentry
entries: (9th-level) Your attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} damage.

entries.name: Switch
entries: If you are within 5 feet of an ally on your turn, you can spend at least 5 feet of your movement to switch places with that ally. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. In addition, you may roll {@dice 1d6}. Until the start of your next turn, your ally gains a bonus to their AC equal to the number rolled.

entries.name: Greater Switch
entries: (5th-level) The AC bonus increases from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Switch
entries: (9th-level) The AC bonus increases from {@dice 1d8} to {@dice 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Defender's Mark
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can mark the creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or you die, or if someone else marks the creature.
While it is within 5 feet of you, a creature marked by you has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you.

entries.name: Punishing Attack
entries: If a creature marked by you deals damage to anyone other than you, you can make a special melee weapon attack against the marked creature as a bonus action on your next turn. You have advantage on the attack roll, and if it hits, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to half your fighter level.

Regardless of the number of creatures you mark, you can make this special attack a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (a minimum of 1). You may also spend 1 point of resolve to use this feature. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Defender's Ward
entries: If you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can roll {@dice 1d8} as a reaction if you're wielding a melee weapon or a shield. Roll the die, and add the number rolled to the target's AC against that attack. If the attack still hits, the target has resistance against the attack's damage.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of 1). You may also spend 1 point of resolve to use this feature. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hold the Line
entries: Creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they move 5 feet or more while within your reach. If you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Elementalist
entries: You are the still center of the turning wheel. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the elements to your will.
Add the following four mantras to your list of mantra options:

entries.name: Balance of All Things
entries: When you make an ability check and use Acrobatics or Religion, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this mantra, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Balance of All Things:
entries: (5th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Balance of All Things:
entries: (9th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d8} to {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Fury of Elements
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon melee attack, you can change the type of damage you deal. Choose one of cold, fire, bludgeoning, lightning, or thunder—your attack deals this damage type. In addition, you deal {@damage 1d6} additional damage of the same type.

entries.name: Greater Fury of Elements:
entries: (5th-level) The additional damage you deal increases from {@damage 1d6} to {@damage 1d8}..

entries.name: Superior Fury of Elements:
entries: (9th-level) The additional damage you deal increases from {@damage 1d8} to {@damage 1d10}.

entries.name: Clutch of the Wild
entries: When you hit a Large or smaller creature with a weapon melee attack, you can attempt to trap it using elemental power. The creature must make a Strength saving throw. If it fails, the creature is grappled.

entries.name: Greater Clutch of the Wild:
entries: (5th-level) You can use this mantra on Huge creatures..

entries.name: Superior Clutch of the Wild:
entries: (9th-level) You can use this mantra on Gargantuan creatures.

entries.name: Shield of Elements
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can shield yourself with elemental power to drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this mantra again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Greater Shield of Elements:
entries: (5th-level) You can use this mantra two times per long rest..

entries.name: Superior Shield of Elements:
entries: (9th-level) You can use this mantra three times per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Arts
entries: You gain the ability to cast powerful elemental arts by channeling the ki that flows within you.

entries.name: Learning Elemental Arts
entries: At 3rd-level, you know three arts of your choice from the elementalist spell list. The spell level of your elemental arts must be lower than or equal to your maximum spell level.
You learn additional arts of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the {@i Arts Known} column of the Class Features (Elementalist) table.

entries.name: Replacing Known Arts:
entries: When you finish a long rest, you may replace one of your known elemental arts with another option from the elementalist spell list.

entries.name: Casting Elemental Arts
entries: To cast an elemental art of 1st-level or higher, you must spend a number of ki points as shown in the {@i Elementalist Spellcasting} table. You must use the spell's casting time and other rules—but you don't need to provide material components for it.

entries.name: Upcasting Spells:
entries: When casting an elemental art at a higher spell level, you can't exceed your {@i Maximum Spell Level}—even if you have enough ki points.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your elemental art spells. Use your Wisdom modifier to determine the saving throw DC or attack modifier for spells that you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Spear of Elements
entries: When you spend an action to cast an elemental art, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. The range of this unarmed attack is increased by +10 ft.

entries.name: Elemental Flurry of Blows:
entries: Immediately after you spend an action to cast an elemental art, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action. The range of these unarmed attacks is increased by +10 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Variable Arts
entries: When you learn a {@i variable} elemental art, you can choose what type of damage that elemental art deals—fire, cold, bludgeoning, lightning, or thunder. You may learn a variable elemental art multiple times, choosing a new damage type each time.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Avatar
entries: At 10th-level, you have become deeply attuned to the elements of nature. When you finish a long rest, choose one of the following masteries:

items: {@b Avatar of Air} ({@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE})
{@b Avatar of Earth} ({@spell Investiture of Stone|XGE})
{@b Avatar of Fire} ({@spell Investiture of Flame|XGE})
{@b Avatar of Water} ({@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE})

entries: You can spend an action to freely invoke your chosen avatar. You may use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Open Hand
entries: You are a master of the martial arts, using special techniques to push, trip, and daze your opponents.
Add the following four mantras to your list of mantra options:

entries.name: Will of the Dragon
entries: When you make an ability check and use Acrobatics or Athletics, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this mantra, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Will of the Dragon:
entries: (5th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Will of the Dragon:
entries: (9th-level) Your bonus increases from {@dice 1d8} to {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Pinch of Death
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to hit a nerve cluster. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is reduce to 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Greater Pinch of Death:
entries: (5th-level) You can use this mantra on Huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Pinch of Death:
entries: (9th-level) You can use this mantra on Gargantuan creatures.

entries.name: Snake Fist
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a Large or smaller creature with a weapon attack, you can attempt to make the creature drop an item. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the creature drops one item of your choice that it is holding. If you are adjacent to the creature, you can catch the dropped item if you are unrestrained and have at least one free hand.

entries.name: Greater Snake Fist:
entries: (5th-level) You can use this mantra on Huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Snake Fist:
entries: (9th-level) You can use this mantra on Gargantuan creatures.

entries.name: Circle of Steel
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If the attack hits, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage with your weapon.

entries.name: Greater Circle of Steel:
entries: (5th-level) The additional damage increases from {@damage 1d6} to {@damage 1d8}.

entries.name: Superior Circle of Steel:
entries: (9th-level) The additional damage increases from {@damage 1d8} to {@damage 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Open Hand Technique
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your {@i Flurry of Blows}, you can impose one of the following effects on that creature:

items: {@b Axe Kick:} The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. If it fails, it is knocked {@condition prone}.
{@b Fists of Fury:} The creature must make a Strength saving throw. If it fails, you can push it up to 15 feet away from you.
{@b Palm Strike:} The creature can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Wholeness of Body
entries: As an action, you can regain hit points equal to three times your monk level. You can use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Quivering Palm
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, you can attempt to create deadly vibrations within their body. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the creature is afflicted with imperceptible vibrations that last until you next finish a long rest.

You can spend an action to resonate these vibrations—at which point, the vibrations end and the creature suffers {@damage 5d10} necrotic damage. If the creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage, it dies immediately.
You can use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Shadow
entries: As a way of the Shadow Monk, you have gained a nightmarish power from a traumatic experience influenced by magical forces. Your skin is chilling to the touch, and your eyes hold lingering darkness within them. While sleeping, you don't appear to breathe, though the air still circulates through your lungs via more subtle means.
Add the following four mantras to your list of mantra options:

entries.name: Shadow Leap
entries: You can use a bonus action to quickly summon spectral hands to allow you to leap 20 feet in a straight line in any direction including up. This leap does not count towards the amount of movement you can use on your turn.

entries.name: Greater Shadow Leap
entries: (5th level) The leap distance increases to 30 feet.

entries.name: Superior Shadow Leap
entries: (9th level) The leap distance increases to 40 feet.

entries.name: Spectral Grasp
entries: When you hit a Large or smaller creature with an unarmed attack roll, you can attempt to grapple them as part of the same action. The target must make a Strength saving throw or be grappled by you. If they are grappled by one of your spectral hands, you can move them to any space within the reach of your spectral hands.

entries.name: Greater Spectral Grasp
entries: (5th level) You can use this mantra against Huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Spectral Grasp
entries: (9th level) You can use this mantra against Gargantuan creatures.

entries.name: Dark Presence
entries: When you make an {@skill Insight} or {@skill Intimidation} check, you may add {@dice 1d6} to the roll.

entries.name: Greater Dark Presence
entries: (5th level) You may add {@dice 1d8} to the roll instead of {@dice 1d6}.

entries.name: Superior Dark Presence
entries: (9th level) You may add {@dice 1d10} to the roll instead of {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Fade
entries: When a large or smaller creature hits you with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to turn invisible until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Greater Fade
entries: (5th level) You can use this mantra against huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Fade
entries: (9th level) You can use this mantra against gargantuan creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts
entries: You can use your ki to duplicate the effects of certain spells. As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell darkness}, {@spell pass without trace}, or {@spell silence}, without providing material components.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Hands
entries: Your power manifests in the form of invisible hands that you can summon to do your bidding. You can spend a ki point to summon a number of spectral hands equal to your proficiency bonus for 10 minutes. These hands cannot be seen directly, but cast a visible shadow and can be seen through reflections and therefore do not grant advantage on attack rolls.

While this ability is active, when you make an unarmed strike as an action, bonus action, or extra attack, you can attack with the spectral hand instead of your own hands. You can only make as many attacks per turn with your spectral hands as you have spectral hands active. The spectral hands have a reach of a number of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus and use your wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of strength or dexterity. Unarmed strikes with the spectral hands deal necrotic damage instead of bludgeoning. Lastly, while the spectral hands are active, you can use your Wisdom modifier for strength checks and saving throws.

If your traumatic experience takes the shape of another kind of appendage or shape, you may flavor the shadow and reflection of your hands to look like something else such as chains or tentacles for example.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Slink
entries: You gain the ability to slink from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action you can spend a ki point to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. You then have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.
Additionally, you can see through darkness both magical and non-magical as if it were bright light, though you can still see how dark it really is.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Double
entries: Once per long rest, you can use an action to create a shadow clone of yourself in a place you can see within 30 feet of you. The shadow clone obeys your commands and has access to all of your features, proficiencies, and ability scores though you also share a pool of actions and ki. You can only have one clone of yourself active at a time. Your clone lasts for 1 hour, has 40 hitpoints that are separate from your own, and you can swap places with your clone as a reaction during one of another creature's actions.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Devotion
entries: In swearing an oath of devotion, you hold yourself to the highest ideals of justice, virtue, and order.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Devotion
entries: You have sworn a vow to uphold these sacred tenets:

items: {@b I will protect those who can't protect themselves:} Protect the weak and punish those who threaten them.
{@b I will never be cruel or cowardly:} Treat others with fairness. Do as much good as possible while causing the least amount of harm. Show mercy to your foes, but temper it with wisdom.
{@b I will take responsibility for my words and actions:} Own the things you say and do. Honor your promises, put order before chaos, and obey those who have just authority over you.

entries: You gain the following Lay on Hands ability:

entries.name: Healing Touch
entries: When you touch a creature, you may cast {@spell Cure Wounds} as a 1st-level spell without first needing to prepare the spell or spend any conviction points.
You may use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Greater Healing Touch:
entries: Starting at 5th-level, you may use this feature twice. Each time, you cast {@spell Cure Wounds} as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Superior Healing Touch:
entries: Starting at 9th-level, you may use this feature three times. Each time, you cast {@spell Cure Wounds} as a 3rd-level spell.
Add the following to your list of smite and aura options.

entries.name: Protection
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend two conviction points to deal an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. In addition, a creature of your choice that is within 30 ft gains a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Greater Protection:
entries: (5th-level, +1 conviction) The base damage increases to {@damage 2d8} and the temporary hit points gained increases to {@dice 2d6} + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Superior Protection:
entries: (9th-level, +3 conviction) The base damage increases to {@damage 3d8} and the temporary hit points gained increases to {@dice 2d8} + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Aura of Clarity
entries: You and friendly creatures within 10 ft of you can't be charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain the following oath spells.

entries.caption: Oath of Devotion Spells
rows: {@spell Protection from Evil and Good}, {@spell Sanctuary}

subclassFeature.name: Protect the Fallen
entries: When an ally within 15 feet of you would be reduced to 0 hit points from a weapon attack, you spend your reaction to move up to half your speed adjacent to your ally—that ally then drops to 1 hit point instead.
You can use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Judge the Wicked
entries: As an action, you can imbue one weapon that you are holding with positive energy. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon (with a minimum bonus of +1). The weapon also emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that. If the weapon is not already magical, it becomes magical for the duration.

This effect lasts for up to one minute. You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you are no longer holding or carrying this weapon, or if you fall unconscious, this effect ends.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Constancy
entries: Choose one of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Vow
entries: When a creature within 60 ft of you makes an explicit promise to you, you can spend a reaction to turn that promise into a sacred vow. You and the creature must both be able to hear and understand each other.

The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the creature is magically bound to honor the spirit of its promise to you. The creature takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage each time it acts in a manner which contradicts its promise—but no more than once per day. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this effect dies immediately, and you regain {@dice 1d8} expended conviction points.
This effect ends when (a) the creature fulfills its promise, (b) the promise is rendered impossible to achieve, or (c) you finish a long rest.
You can use this feature once and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Perseverance
entries: The Oath of Perseverance dedicates a paladin to a noble pursuit no matter the odds. Sometimes refered to as guardians, white knights, and even fool knights. These paladins are dedicated to fighting the incessant evils in the world, and are the embodiment of hope for those that are already ravaged by it. Although their success may be unattainable, they do not falter in their goal to push evil back and out of this world. Often wearing symbols to denote this unending quest such as circles, loops, and rings. Most who swear this oath are devoted to gods of good.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Perseverance
entries: You have sworn a vow to follow these sacred tenets:

items: {@b Undying Determination.} I am a beacon of hope. If I should fall, hope will as well. I will struggle to prevent this no matter the opposition.
{@b Fight Adversity.} Failure to meet challenges head on is the downfall of hope. In order to keep hope alive, I will not back down.
{@b Lead the Charge.} I will lead the charge, and show others the way.

subclassFeature.name: Persevere Together
entries: You may cast {@spell Bless} as a 1st-level spell without needing to prepare the spell or spend any conviction points. You may use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Greater Persevere Together:
entries: Starting at 5th-level, you may cast {@spell Enhance Ability} at 2nd level instead of {@spell Bless}.
Add the following smite to your list of smite options.

entries.name: Inspiring
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend two conviction points to deal an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. In addition, the next attack against the creature has advantage.

entries.name: Greater Inspiring:
entries: Starting at 5th level, if you spend +1 Conviction, the base damage increases to {@damage 2d8}.

entries.name: Superior Inspiring:
entries: Starting at 9th level, if you spend +3 Conviction, the base damage increases to {@damage 3d8}.

entries.name: Aura of Inspiration
entries: When you and any friendly creatures within 10 feet of you make an ability check, they may roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the result.

subclassFeature.name: Push Through
entries: As a reaction, you or a creature within 30 feet of you may reroll a failed saving throw or ability check. Additionally, the target rolls a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the result. They must use the new roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Defy Death
entries: You can forgo rolling for a death saving throw, taking a 20 as the result.
You can use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fortify Resolve
entries: As a reaction to a creature taking damage within 5 feet of you, you may grant them resistance to one type of damage dealt by the attack.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Persevere on Your Journey
entries: As an action, you may bless a creature with a holy oath of their own. In a single sentence, describe what they are vowing to do. They can then roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to any ability checks they make that follow the vow. As well, any ability checks they make that directly go against the vow must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result from the check. A creature may make a Wisdom save against your spell DC to resist the vow.
The vow lasts until what they have vowed is complete or you start a new vow.
You can use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Walker
entries: You can speak the primal language of nature. Perhaps you have always been drawn to the natural world, or you received some guidance from a druidic mentor? Perhaps the blood of the fey flows in your veins?
Whatever your background, you have an innate and magical connection with the primal powers of nature.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You gain the ability to cast spells by harnessing the primal essence of nature.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Spellcasting (Primal) table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st-level and higher. To cast one of your spells, you must spend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-level and Higher
entries: At 1st-level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the ranger spell list. The {@i Spells Known} column of the Spellcasting (Primal) table shows when you learn more ranger spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Replacing Known Spells:
entries: When you gain a ranger level, you may choose one of the ranger spells you know and replace it with another spell from the ranger spell list. This new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your ranger spells. Use your Wisdom modifier to determine the saving throw DC or attack modifier for a ranger spell you cast.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You use a {@item druidic focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your ranger spells.

entries.name: Primal Versatility
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can replace one of your known ranger spells with another spell from the ranger spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Trap
entries: Spend 1 scrap to prepare a primal trap. When a creature that you can see moves within 30 ft of you, you can activate a primal trap. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, magical plant roots erupt from the ground in a 15 ft radius circle centered on the creature. The ground is considered as difficult terrain. This effect lasts for up to 10 minutes.

items: {@b Stumble:} {@i (+1 scrap)} On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.
{@b Distracting:} {@i (+2 scrap)} Concentration saving throws made within the primal area have disadvantage.
{@b Thorns:} {@i (+1 scrap)} On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d4} piercing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Awareness
entries: You are able to focus your natural awareness. You can cast each of the spells listed below once without expending a spell slot, even if they are not on your known spell list.
Once you cast a spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.caption: Primal Awareness
rows: {@spell Beast Sense}, {@spell Locate Animals or Plants}

subclassFeature.name: Fey Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain—including that caused by your primal trap—costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement—such those created by the {@spell Entangle} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Vanish
entries: You can spend a bonus action to magically become {@condition invisible}—along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying—until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Magician
entries: Magicians are masters of illusion. They skillfully guide your attention toward games and facades to distract you from what they do in the shadows. Of course, none of it is real magic, but the more you think you see, the easier it will be to fool you. Or in other words, the closer you look, the less you see.
Add the following four exploits to your list of exploit options: Beguile, Switcheroo, Deposit, Disappear.

items.name: Beguile
entries: When you make an ability check and use Deception or Performance, you can roll 1d6 and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this exploit, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Beguile:
entries: Starting at 5th level, you may roll 1d6 and add it to the roll.

entries.name: Superior Beguile:
entries: Starting at 9th level, you may roll 1d8 and add it to the roll.

items.name: Switcheroo
entries: When you deal your sneak attack damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can attempt to switch places with the target creature if the target is within 15 feet of you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you and the creature switch places. When you switch places with a large or larger creature, it can be moved anywhere so long as square touches your old position

entries.name: Greater Switcheroo:
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can target huge creatures with this exploit.

entries.name: Superior Switcheroo:
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can target gargantuan creatures with this exploit.

items.name: Deposit
entries: When you hit an adjacent Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack and you have a small item in one hand, you can attempt to plant it on that creature. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, deposit that item into that creature's inventory. You must be able to hold your deposited item comfortably with one hand. If you had advantage on your attack roll, you can choose to trigger one additional effect. Don: If the item can be worn (eg: Gloves, Watches, Manacles), the target must wear the item. Inconspicuous: The creature is not immediately aware that it has been planted on them.

entries.name: Greater Deposit:
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can use this exploit against Huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Deposit:
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can use this exploit against Gargantuan creatures.

items.name: Disappear
entries: When a Larger or smaller creature makes a weapon attack against you, you can spend your reaction to attempt teleport 10 feet away from your current location after the creature makes the attack roll. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature loses sight of you and you teleport. If the destination you chose to teleport to is behind cover, you can attempt to teleport before the creature makes the attack roll. At your discretion, this exploit can leave behind a small sensory effect like birds flying away or cards scattering before being burned up like flash-paper at your previous location.

entries.name: Greater Disappear:
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can teleport 20 feet away.

entries.name: Superior Disappear:
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can teleport 30 feet away.

subclassFeature.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: You know how to land a strike and then slip away without reprisal. During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: The Long Game
entries: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit, the forgery kit, and one gaming set of your choice.
You also gain the ability to use dice and Dragonchess pieces as sling bullets, and cards as daggers, adding your proficiency bonus to the attack roll.

Additionally, you can unerringly mimic the speech patterns and accent of a creature that you hear speak for at least 1 minute, enabling you to pass yourself off as a native speaker of a particular land, provided that you know the language. Upon listening to them for an hour, you can imitate that creature's individual voice near-perfectly.

subclassFeature.name: Hypnotic Trigger
entries: Your voice becomes an alluring and commanding presence. You gain the ability to cast the {@spell Suggestion} spell without any material components. You can use this ability once per long rest at 3rd level, twice per long rest at 6th level, and 3 times per long rest at 9th level.

While the spell is active, if you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with the target outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: Constitution score
Intelligence score
Wisdom score
Charisma score
Class levels (if any)

entries: At the DM's option, you might also realize you know a piece of the creature's history or one of its personality traits, if it has any.

subclassFeature.name: The Closer You Look
entries: You have advantage on attempts to pickpocket and make attack rolls and against creatures that have made attack rolls against you or targetted you with single target spells/effects within the last turn.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Spectacle
entries: You have an eye for the flashiest items in the room and know how to use them to create a massive spectacle. As an action, you can quickly use "invisible" strings to pull up to three objects you have touched with your hands in the last minute so long as they remained within 30 feet of you since you've touched them. These objects become extremely distracting for up to 5 minutes. Creatures within 20 feet of one of these objects must make a wisdom saving throw against your Exploit Save DC or be {@condition blinded} for up to 5 minutes or until your spectacle ends. During your spectacle, you can move any of these objects to another location within 30 feet of you. The spectacle ends when you choose to stop maneuvering the objects or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).
You can use this ability once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Thief
entries: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype—but so do treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators.
In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn't employ.
Add the following four exploits to your list of exploit options: heist, pickpocket, robbery, and slink.

items.name: Heist
entries: When you make an ability check and use Deception or Sleight of Hand, you can roll 1d6 and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this exploit, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Heist:
entries: (5th-level) Your bonus increases from 1d6 to 1d8.

entries.name: Superior Heist:
entries: (9th-level) Your bonus increases from 1d8 to 1d10.

items.name: Pickpocket
entries: When you hit an adjacent Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack and you have at least one free hand, you can attempt to pickpocket it. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you take hold of one item of your choice that the creature carries and is not currently wearing or wielding. You must be able to hold your pickpocketed item comfortably with one hand. If you had advantage on your attack roll, the creature is not immediately aware that they have been pickpocketed by you.

entries.name: Greater Pickpocket:
entries: (5th-level) You can use this exploit against Huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Pickpocket:
entries: (9th-level) You can use this exploit against Gargantuan creatures.

items.name: Robbery
entries: When you deal your sneak attack damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can attempt to make the creature drop an item. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the creature drops one item of your choice that it is holding. If you are adjacent to the creature, you can catch the dropped item if you are unrestrained and have at least one free hand.

entries.name: Greater Robbery:
entries: (5th-level) You can use this exploit against Huge creatures.

entries.name: Superior Robbery:
entries: (9th-level) You can use this exploit against Gargantuan creatures.

items.name: Slink
